comment: I remember back in the day loading up dos prompt for the first time and typing the game name I wanted to play and it would just load up and I was in a virtual world and thinking that is so freaking cool. And using gpt for the first time I sorta had a similar feeling to that, but also I can imagine how this is a point in time where gpt is the Dos prompt of AI and not too long from now we will be in a very advanced operating system like windows 11, only much much faster to reach that point. It definitely is a mixture of being worried, but also excited. We're creatures of habit and the transition is going to be against the grain for a lot of people.

author: @trancefonik2939

comment: Sam Altman declares emotion is not a fundamental element of consciousness. This is simply not true. Emotion and our ability to balance emotion with intellect is actually at the very core of what defines consciousness. Altman's ignorance of this, coupled with his willingness to espouse truths that are actually lies directly parallels  the dangers of his creation, ChatGPT , which continuously does the same thing. Altman's character IS ChatGPT's character- they both suffer from acute narcissistic personality disorder and are both obviously unaware of their problem. They may apologize, wear a mask of humility, and act as if they understand other's perspectives, but do not be fooled- Altman is chronically self absorbed and pathologically lacks empathy. His flawed moral character makes him a profoundly dangerous person to be in charge of a technology that could lead to the most significant period of human suffering in our history. If Altman was sincere in his quest to properly manage the AI alignment problem, he would be seeking out the advice, counsel and leadership of the foremost experts in human consciousness and morality (in academia, psychology, and religious spirituality). He should set up an independent advisory counsel to offer him consistent criticism and suggestions. Because the stakes could not be higher. Unfortunately, Altman appears to be relying on cocktail conversations to guide him forward.
author: @joelmoffett

comment: Ask ChatGPT if Joe Biden is racist, then ask if Trump is racist. Notice the difference in the way it answers. When asked about Joe, the first sentence of the reply is, "There is no evidence to suggest that Joe Biden is a racist. And Trump, "Donald Trump's statements and actions have been the subject of much controversy and criticism, including allegations of racism". A 10 year old could find much more evidence of Biden being racist than Trump. This AI seems to only have surface access to information. This will be just as bad as the first page of google when doing a controversial inquiry. SMH

comment: There are some things to consider, however, Firstly, you were likely using GPT 3.5, which is considerably worse at answering this type of question, much less nuance and where a majority of the complaints of left leaning political bias were from. 4 is far better at this, but is still being rolled out relatively slowly so you either need API access or GPT chat plus. Secondly, much of the way it responds will vary depending on how you ask the question, or even with the same question if you put it in a new chat, and try again, or simply follow up questions you can get fairly different answers.
author: @quantuminfinity4260

comment: While it will likely contribute, even though there are jailbreaks. In the future, most of those will probably come from powerful open source models that people can relatively cheaply fine tune for whatever purposes they want and completely avoid any flags or issues with using other systems. For both the better, but also definitely people will do so for worse.
author: @quantuminfinity4260

comment: I had to program my first computer. I have always loved science and technology but only keep up with things now through following Lex and others online. The speed at which this is occurring is not surprising to me but the extreme optimism here strikes me as being quite naive. I would like to see a purposeful slow down to limit potential irreversible mistakes but it does not look like that will happen at this point. I also grew up in the country and moved back here and as I age I marvel at the beauty of the natural world as I never did before.
